text:

"She has now, partly with our help, managed to make an asylum application. 
"So I think that's been a really positive thing." 
Her application for asylum has been accepted, meaning she will soon be moving out of the peer's home. GETTY The peer admitted he was initially apprehensive about the lodger 
In a separate interview, Lord Bassam admitted he was initially apprehensive about the lodger, whose family are still in Syria. 
He said: "It's like having a friend to stay. I suppose I was a bit nervous to start with about how it would work out. 
"But partly because she's so delightful, I found it easier than I imagined." GETTY SNP chief Nicola Sturgeon promised to house a refugee in late 2015 
A source close to the Bassams said Riam "wants to make a new home here" and offer her "knowledge, language and expertise". 
SNP leader Ms Sturgeon and Labour MP Yvette Cooper pledged to take Syrian refugees into their homes a year and a half ago. 
But both have yet to follow through on their offers. Calais Jungle Camp: Before and After Fri, November 11, 2016 Extraordinary photographs show life in the last days of the Calais 'Jungle' refugee camp at the end of October, alongside the current scene as it stands today.
